title: Island Scrape
text:
Project Link
island-scrape is a scraping tool built for the statistical simulation website The Islands, it is a python script that allows researchers to automate sample collection. Collecting research samples from people:
Map of the entire Island: There’s a lot of cities and people!

title: Island Scrape
text:
Features include:

sample.py - automated sample choosing and collection
collect.py - automated collection of experiment results
cache.py - caching script that makes data collection exponentially faster

title: Island Scrape
text:
Instructions:

clone this respository

install dependencies(requirements.txt) or manually installing the requirements listed here:


pip install selenium
pip install numpy
pip install pandas
You also will need Google Chrome installed on the pc

create a passwords.config file(look at sample-passwords.config for instructions)
generate a cache file by running cache.py

python cache.py
the file should be stored in a binary file called cache

In sample.py edit the ##TASK## code for your specific size, and edit the SAMPLE_SIZE constant and run it using:

python sample.py
Outputs a sample_index csv file that notes the indices of the people that you sampled

collect the data by editing the data collection script collect.py. change the ###DO SOMETHING### block to your choosing and run it using:

python collect.py
Visits every person sampled, collects the data and outputs it into a csv file
The data will be outputed into a file named “data1.csv” or can be chaneged to your choosing

title: Island Scrape
text:
Outlines of this project:

scrape.py: building block instances that can navigate through the page
iter.py: navigates through a population on the islan and performs some task(that you implement)
scrath.py: development file for temporary code
login.py: building block for logging into the website
cache.py, sample.py, sample.py finalized working scripts for fast sampling and data collection
iter.py: basic iteration instance over all cities
scrape.py: used for testing one instance of scraping your data collection task
test.py: a combination of scrape.py and iter.py

Potential updates(in the future): + A script that navigates through one’s island contact list + A script that adds all your samples to a contact list + A script that allows randomization of experiments
This project was built using Selenium and Python3, and works with the integrated Chrome Web Driver

title: EarBloom: A Bio-Inspired Intersection of High-Fidelity Hearing Protection and Fashion Technology
text: In collaboration with Ph.D. candidate Yin Yu, I developed EarBloom, a fashionable wearable prototype designed to prevent noise-induced hearing loss, during a research project (06/2021 – 07/2021). The project involved creating detailed CAD models, conducting functional simulations in Rhino 3D, and performing material stress tests in Fusion 360 to ensure durability and feasibility. The research findings were presented at a faculty seminar and later published in the Journal of Student Research (September 2021). Discover more about the project here.

title: Bryan Mui
text:
DOWNLOAD CV
I am student at the University of California, Los Angeles majoring in Statistics and minoring in Data Science Engineering!
This past summer I’ve been graciously give the oportunity to intern at Stiddle, an early stage B2B SaaS company for marketers and ecommerce brands. I worked on developing integrations with their platforms and carving out features. We’re a small team that can code features together where everyone has a loose role in meeting our feature and sales goals.
I’m currently looking for a cool project to pursue or a research program to get into. I am a hopeful believer in Jesus Christ.

title: Bryan Mui
text:
Experience:
Software Engineering Intern (Stiddle, June–September 2024): Developed scalable integrations and expanded platform functionality to reach 5 million brands using NestJS, React, and JavaScript.
Machine Learning Research Program (NYU Pathways to AI, June–December 2023): Explored computer vision projects, ML models, and optimization strategies as one of 10 Google DeepMind-funded participants.
Volunteer (RobotGarden, June 2020–September 2022): Built tools, repaired machinery, and advanced autonomous driving rover projects using RC cars and drone controllers.
Soccer Referee (California North Referee Association, January 2018–December 2019): Officiated gold-level youth soccer games, ensuring fair play and enforcing rules with thorough training.

title: Hand Detection
text: During my internship with NYU Pathways to AI (09/2023 – 12/2023), I developed a script leveraging a pre-trained Detectron2 classification model to analyze videos featuring hand movements. This project demonstrated the semi-effective tracking of hands within dynamic, real-world contexts, such as DIY YouTube videos. Built with OpenCV2, Detectron2, and Google Colab, this effort reflects my hands-on experience with cutting-edge machine learning tools and object detection frameworks. You can view the project’s repository on GitHub.

title: WatchCircle for LA 2028
text: As part of the AWS + Slalom Innovation Challenge (03/2023 – 06/2023), I developed WatchCircle, a social media platform tailored for the 2028 LA Olympics, aimed at boosting user engagement and viewership. The project included designing a robust tech framework using AWS database technologies to ensure user data protection. Additionally, I pitched a Figma app prototype and a comprehensive business model to the official LA 2028 Olympics board of representatives, combining technological innovation with strategic vision. Explore the project here.
